poem:
Title: The Paradox of Uncollected Thoughts

Imperfect regret,
The Archbishop's paradox, refused
a Palestinian pastor now invites.
In the Christmas town cries a Lutheran note,
Promised meeting in the realm of a week.

Red seeds of forgiveness in labor,
Sprouted cerulean crosses.
A softened stance,
A síralo* promise groping in the dark, 
An echo of the anticipated hello.

(* "síralo" means "upcoming" in Hungarian)
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Justin Welby expresses ‘deep regret’ at refusal to meet Palestinian pastor The archbishop of Canterbury has expressed his deep regret at his decision to refuse to meet a renowned Palestinian pastor if he shared a political platform with the former Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn. Justin Welby said in a post on social media he would now meet the Rev Dr Munther Isaac, next week. The pastor of the Christmas Evangelical Lutheran church in Bethlehem, who". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
